A Critique of Narrow Content
7. A Critique of Narrow Content

Since the first introduction of the term “narrow content,”
some authors have doubted that there is any useful concept for it to
capture (see e.g. Stalnaker 1990; Burge 2007, pp. 11–13). The
most sustained critique of narrow content is a relatively recent book,
Narrow Content, by Juhani Yli-Vakkuri and John Hawthorne
(Yli-Vakkuri and Hawthorne 2018).
